page.title: 08Heating
page.content: The survey shows that a variety of fuel is used in the area. Many of the houses and farmhouses have solid fuel stoves which burn either wood or anthracite. Many houses use oil as well as coal and wood, only one person said she used calor gas and no one heated the home with electricity. There is an adequate supply of wood logs in the area, many people cutting down dead trees on their own property, while others buy logs from neighbours. Coal can be obtained from Bromyard or from a haulier a few miles away who delivers a small amount weekly or larger quantities to order at any time.
